note: As well as the notarii, this group also included the agentes in rebus (messengers who also performed some similar tasks as the notarii) and the members of the various scrinia (clerks who dealt with correspondence, judicial matters and records).
title: notarius (pl: notarii) – the notarii were clerks and bureaucratic officials in the imperial secretariat, but were also regularly employed as representatives of the emperor on official business throughout the empire, including investigating the behaviour of other officials
palatinus (pl: palatini) – palatini was a general title for the civil and administrative functionaries who constituted the central imperial bureaucracy

note: See Jones (1964) I 373–5; Kelly (2004) 72.
title: vicarius (pl: vicarii) – the vicarius was a late Roman civilian official who oversaw the governors of a group of provinces, known as a diocese, and reported to the Praetorian Prefect of the region
